basic.description: This course introduces high-performance computing, term which refers to theuse of parallel supercomputers, computer clusters, as well as software and hardware in order to speed up computations. Students learn to write faster code that is highly optimized for modern multi-core processors and cluster s, using modern software-development tools and performance analyzers, specialized algorithms, parallelization strategies, and advanced parallel programming constructs.
basic.subject: ISC
basic.title: High-Performance Computing

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: ISC 5305 or equivalent or instructor permission.
